headline.main: THE SCIENTIFIC CONGRESS.; American Association for the Advancement of Science. FOURTEEENTH ANNUAL REUNION FIRST DAY

docs.lead_paragraph: The streets and hotels of this gay watering-place have, for a day or two, experienced an unwonted raid, in the persons of the members of the American Scientific Association, and for a week, at least, Philosopy will vie with Fashion and Flirtation, and Science become a serious perturbative element in the round of small talk and scandal incident to life in Newport.

docs.snippet: The regular monthly meeting of the Chamber of Commerce was held yesterday, at the rooms of that bady, corner of Cedar and William streets, the President, PELETIAH PERIT, preciding. The attendance of the members was limited.

docs.snippet: The Cunard steamship Asia, from Liverpool on the 21st and Queenstown on the 22d ult., arrived at this port yesterday afternoon. Her advices have been anticipated by the Prince Albert at St. Johns, but we derive from our correspondence and foreign...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard steamship Asia, from Liverpool on the 21st and Queenstown on the 22d ult., arrived at this port yesterday afternoon. Her advices have been anticipated by the Prince Albert at St. Johns, but we derive from our correspondence and foreign files very interesting details of late foreign news.

docs.snippet: A CHALLENGE. The Paterson Guardian is in favor of inaugurating, in New-Jersey, the Western system of conducting a canvass. It calls on the friends of BRECKINRIDGE or DOUGLAS to meet a Lincoln champion from the West, who is soon to speak in that city,...
docs.lead_paragraph: A CHALLENGE. The Paterson Guardian is in favor of inaugurating, in New-Jersey, the Western system of conducting a canvass. It calls on the friends of BRECKINRIDGE or DOUGLAS to meet a Lincoln champion from the West, who is soon to speak in that city, and informs them that it shall insist on the advocates of LINCOLN'S election being heard in the Democratic Convention soon to assemble to Paterson.

headline.main: DETAILS BY THE CITY OF WASHINGTON.; The Massacres in Lebanon. The Projected Attack on Messina. The Americans and the Prince. The North Atlantic Telegraph. Cession of the Bay Islands. American Slaves in England. From the Liverpool Post. Cruelty on Board American Ships.

docs.lead_paragraph: The screw-steamship City of Washington, Capt. JEFFREY, which sailed from Liverpool at 11 o'clock on the morning of the 18th, and from Queenstown on the 19th of July, arrived at this port yesterday morning. Her advices have been anticipated, but we find in our newspaper files additional details of interest.

docs.snippet: Senator SEWARD, with a large party of NewYorkers and others, has been visiting Little Sodus Bay. Mr.SEWARD'S health was never better, and he is ready at the proper time to buckle on his working harness, and to lend his utmost aid for the furtherance...
docs.lead_paragraph: Senator SEWARD, with a large party of NewYorkers and others, has been visiting Little Sodus Bay. Mr.SEWARD'S health was never better, and he is ready at the proper time to buckle on his working harness, and to lend his utmost aid for the furtherance of the interests of the party of which he was the originator, is the life, and may yet be the popular representative.
